summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General memorandum analyzing surveillance footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, between 10 p.m. and 11 p.m. It compares OIG and FBI analyses of the footage, noting poor video quality, the presence of two assigned correctional officers, and that only one officer appears to be conducting inmate counts during the critical period.

events.title: MCC 10 p.m. Inmate Count
events.description: The MCC's nightly inmate count was documented. The Control Officer logged a 'good verbal count' at 10:30 p.m., but video shows the SHU officer was still walking tiers until at least 10:36 p.m.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: Surveillance footage from the MCC SHU on August 9, 2019, had low quality, making positive identification of individuals impossible beyond possibly determining gender.
Correctional Officers Tova Noel and an unnamed male officer were assigned to the SHU during the 10 p.m. to 11 p.m. period analyzed.
Video analysis shows only one correctional officer walking to 5 of the 6 tiers to conduct counts, contrary to standard procedure requiring two officers.
The MCC's 10 p.m. count document shows a 'good verbal count' was received by 10:30 p.m., but video shows the SHU officer was still moving between tiers until at least 10:36 p.m.
The FBI extracted the video footage from arrays they seized from the MCC on August 11, 2019.
